question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the range of the function $$G(x) = |x+1|-|x-1|~?$$Express your answer in interval notation.
inference:
The range of the function can be found by considering the different cases for the values of $x$.

* Case 1: $$x > 1$$
In this case, both $$x+1$$ and $$x-1$$ are positive, so $$G(x) = x+1-(x-1) = 2$$.

* Case 2: $$-1 < x < 1$$
In this case, $$x+1$$ is positive and $$x-1$$ is negative, so $$G(x) = x+1-(-x+1) = 2x$$.

* Case 3: $$x < -1$$
In this case, both $$x+1$$ and $$x-1$$ are negative, so $$G(x) = -(x+1)-(-x+1) = -2$$.

Therefore, the range of the function is the union of the three intervals: $$(-2, 2] \cup [0, \infty) \cup (-\infty, 0] = (-\infty, -2] \cup [-2, 2]$$
**Final Answer: \boxed{ [-\infty, -2] \cup [-2, 2]}. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
We have $$G(x) = \begin{cases}
-(x+1)+(x-1) &\text{if }x<-1 \\
(x+1)+(x-1) &\text{if }-1\le x<1 \\
(x+1)-(x-1) &\text{if }x\ge 1
\end{cases}.$$Simplifying, we have $$G(x) = \begin{cases}
-2 &\text{if }x<-1 \\
2x &\text{if }-1\le x<1 \\
2 &\text{if }x\ge 1
\end{cases}.$$Therefore, the range of $G(x)$ is $\boxed{[-2,2]}.$
